--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "moin_m19" <moin_m19@...> wrote:
> I am new t=
o Junit. I am working on a project which involves Applets.
> We are followi=
ng standards of seperating GUI logic and Business logic.
> In such case how=
 JUnit can be implemented?
> For example in case of login page, the GUI and=
 actionListener are in
> different classes. How can Junit be done?

David S=
aff recently suggested Abbot on this list, and you've already
heard about j=
fcUnit. I suggest you look over the examples given in
those projects and se=
e how they are used.

> I was trying a program listed on
> http://www.devel=
oper.com/java/other/article.php/10936_1016841_1 for
> Junit. Its asking for=
 junit.extentions.jfcunit.* , in the
> junit-4.2.jar file above mentioned p=
ackages are not found. Where to
> get these packages from? 

jfcUnit is not=
 part of the core JUnit distribution. You need to go to
the jfcUnit website=
 and download the code from there.

HTH,
Joe
